description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnhkl","text":"This protocol is the standard FFPE tissue staining procedure recommended for Multiplex Ion Beam Imaging Time of Flight instrument (MIBI_TOF) developed in the Sean C. Bendall and Michael R. Angelo labs. The protocol has been successfully used for MIBI and is the result of extensive optimization experiments. It is inspired from state-of-the art of immunohistochemistry staining procedures but differs in some very important steps, namely, glutaraldehyde fixation and final washes prior tissue dehydration. Failure to follow exactly all steps described in this procedure may result in inconsistencies in output data after MIBI_TOF acquisition.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"63vau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"91l3v","text":"Staining tissue sections is fairly straightforward but there are few things to be cognizant of, when preparing samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c5o0j","text":"Always try to limit mechanical damage to the sample surface. This can occur when moving the samples with forceps, particularly when the mounting substrates are small.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"og6k","text":"Once the samples have been rehydrated, they cannot dry out until the end of the protocol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3u92n","text":"Be careful at all times to not touch the tissue, in order to not leave any residue.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10s52","text":"Once the samples have been stained, fixed, and dehydrated, they have an indefinite shelf life and can be imaged at any time but need to be stored properly such as in a vacuum chamber or in a sealed vacuum bag","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bah89","text":"MIBI_TOF observes the basic principles of Mass spectrometry. Any contaminant ions present in water or in the air can potentially compromise the integrity of the sample.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bg73g","text":"Therefore to prevent potential contamination, it is important to always use single use lab ware containers to make the solutions. The protocol has been validated using the level of precision of graduated Nalgene bottles and 50 mL tubes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3olnf","text":"The use of washed beakers or graduated cylinders is not considered as good a practice, due possible introduction of contaminants (exemples of sources: barium from lab ware soap or calcium from air dried lab ware)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":212}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
